item.title: Michelle add a quote by Ella Wheeler Wilcox
item.description: "We flatter those we scarcely know, We please the fleeting guest; And deal full many a thoughtless blow, To those who love us best." -- Ella Wheeler Wilcox

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Three o'clock is always too late or too early for anything you want to do." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "A sip of wine, a cigarette, And then it’s time to go. I tidied up the kitchenette; I tuned the old banjo. I’m wanted at the traffic-jam. They’re saving me a seat." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jerry Seinfeld
item.description: "What I don't understand is how women can pour hot wax on their bodies, let it dry, then rip out every single hair by its root and still be scared of spiders." -- Jerry Seinfeld

item.title: Michelle add a quote by John Buckler
item.description: "A child's laughter is the greatest sound in the world. A child's laughter in a cornfield is the creepiest sound in the world. -- " -- John Buckler

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Sydney J. Harris
item.description: "It's odd, and a little unsettling, to reflect upon the fact that English is the only major language in which "I" is capitalized; in many other languages "You" is capitalized and the "i" is lower case." --" -- Sydney J. Harris

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
Michelle add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "There are people in the world so hungry, that God cannot appear to them except in the form of bread." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Michelle add a quote by C. S. Lewis
item.description: "He's not safe, but he's good (referring to Aslan, the Lion, in The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe)" -- C. S. Lewis

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description:
"Let the first act of every morning be to make the following resolve for the day:
- I shall not fear anyone on Earth. - I shall fear only God. - I shall not bear ill will toward anyone. - I shall not submit to injustice from anyone. - I shall conquer untruth by truth. And in resisting untruth, I shall put up with all suffering." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Hubert Van Zeller
item.description: "What the soul hardly realizes is that, unbeliever or not, his loneliness is really a homesickness for God." -- Hubert Van Zeller

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I believe in the fundamental truth of all great religions of the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Ginnetta Correli
item.description: "Children and dogs are the messengers of God some of us do not deserve them" -- Ginnetta Correli

item.title: Michelle add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It is safe to tell the pure in heart that they shall see God, for only the pure in heart want to." -- C.S. Lewis
